title: Constant crashing when labelling using deeplabcut.label_frames(config_path)
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

When labelling, using: `deeplabcut.label_frames(config_path)`, DLC constantly crashes the Jupyter kernel. Maybe once every 5-10 minutes or so. Either labelling frames or moving from one frame to the next. Usually there is no error other than Jupyter kernel has restarted. Finally saw an error message so I decided I should post here in case anyone else has experienced anything similar:



### Operating System

Windows 10 21H2

### DeepLabCut version

2.2.2

### DeepLabCut mode

multi animal

### Device type

GPU, cuda

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Env
```
packages in environment at C:\ProgramData\Miniconda3\envs\deeplabcut:
```

3. Config
```
...
multianimalproject: true
identity: false
...
individuals:
- l01
- l02
- l03
- l04
- l05
- l06
- l07
- l08
- l09
- l10
- l11
- l12
- l13
- l14
- l15
- l16
- l17
- l18
- l19
- l20
- l21
- l22
- l23
- l24
- l25
- l26
- l27
- l28
- l29
- l30
- l31
- l32
- l33
- l34
- l35
- l36
- l37
- l38
- l39
- l40
uniquebodyparts: []
multianimalbodyparts:
- tip
- middle
bodyparts: MULTI!

    # Fraction of video to start/stop when extracting frames for labeling/refinement
start: 0
stop: 1
numframes2pick: 2

    # Plotting configuration
skeleton:
- - bodypart1
  - bodypart2
- - bodypart2
  - bodypart3
- - bodypart1
  - bodypart3
skeleton_color: black
pcutoff: 0.6
dotsize: 4
alphavalue: 0.7
colormap: rainbow

    # Training,Evaluation and Analysis configuration
TrainingFraction:
- 0.95
iteration: 0
default_net_type: dlcrnet_ms5
default_augmenter: multi-animal-imgaug
default_track_method: ellipse
snapshotindex: -1
batch_size: 8

    # Cropping Parameters (for analysis and outlier frame detection)
cropping: false
    #if cropping is true for analysis, then set the values here:
x1: 0
x2: 640
y1: 277
y2: 624

    # Refinement configuration (parameters from annotation dataset configuration also relevant in this stage)
corner2move2:
- 50
- 50
move2corner: true
```
5. Run
Run `deeplabcut.label_frames(config_path)`


### Relevant log output

```shell
TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +: 'float' and 'NoneType'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\ProgramData\Miniconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\cbook\__init__.py", line 287, in process
    func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Miniconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\multiple_individuals_labeling_toolbox.py", line 669, in onClick
    self.axes.add_patch(circle[0])
  File "C:\ProgramData\Miniconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\axes\_base.py", line 2363, in add_patch
    self._update_patch_limits(p)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Miniconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\axes\_base.py", line 2386, in _update_patch_limits
    patch_trf = patch.get_transform()
  File "C:\ProgramData\Miniconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\patches.py", line 278, in get_transform
    return self.get_patch_transform() + artist.Artist.get_transform(self)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Miniconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\patches.py", line 1546, in get_patch_transform
    self._recompute_transform()
  File "C:\ProgramData\Miniconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\patches.py", line 1536, in _recompute_transform
    self._patch_transform = transforms.Affine2D() \
  File "C:\ProgramData\Miniconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\transforms.py", line 2052, in translate
    self._mtx[0, 2] += tx
TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +: 'float' and 'NoneType'
```


### Anything else?

_No response_
